1 Timothy__04.1: Now the Spirit manifestly saith, that in the last times some shall depart from the faith, giving heed to spirits of error, and doctrines of devils,
1 Timothy__04.2: Speaking lies in hypocrisy, and having their conscience seared,
1 Timothy__04.3: <u>Forbidding to marry, to abstain from meats</u>, which God hath created to be received with thanksgiving by the faithful, and by them that have known the truth.
1 Timothy__04.4: For every creature of God is good, and nothing to be rejected that is received with thanksgiving:
1 Timothy__04.5: For it is sanctified by the word of God and prayer.
1 Timothy__04.6: These things proposing to the brethren, thou shalt be a good minister of Christ Jesus, nourished up in the words of faith, and of the good doctrine which thou hast attained unto.
1 Timothy__04.7: But avoid foolish and old wives' fables: and exercise thyself unto godliness.
1 Timothy__04.8: For bodily exercise is profitable to little: but godliness is profitable to all things, having promise of the life that now is, and of that which is to come.
1 Timothy__04.9: A faithful saying and worthy of all acceptation.
1 Timothy__04.10: For therefore we labor and are reviled, because we hope in the living God, who is the Saviour of all men, especially of the faithful.
1 Timothy__04.12: Let no man despise thy youth: but be thou an example of the faithful in word, in conversation, in charity, in faith, in chastity.
1 Timothy__04.13: Till I come, attend unto reading, to exhortation, and to doctrine.
1 Timothy__04.14: Neglect not the grace that is in thee, which was given thee by prophesy, with imposition of the hands of the priesthood.
1 Timothy__04.15: Meditate upon these things, be wholly in these things: that thy profiting may be manifest to all.
1 Timothy__04.16: Take heed to thyself and to doctrine: be earnest in them. For in doing this thou shalt both save thyself and them that hear thee.
